text: Hopea foxworthyi is an evergreen tree of the family Dipterocarpaceae. It is endemic to Sibuyan Island in the Philippines. The species has been designated as Endangered by the International Union for the Conservation of Nature (IUCN). The survival of this tree in the wild is threatened by widespread harvesting of its wood which is used as construction timber. It grows in primary forest at altitudes up to . ==References== foxworthyi Category:Endemic flora of the Philippines Category:Trees of the Philippines Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
